cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is not a heatwave right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 16.6mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked 2nd from our records.  The precipitation lasted 3.2 hours and dumped 5.69mm in total.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.
Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (198°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 66.41 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 1.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.1 mm), feels like temperature (up 2.2°C), outside temperature (up 1.7°C), and cloud levels (up 871 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 623.9m higher than yesterday, 205.6m higher than the past week, 871.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 565m and a peak of 1838m, averaging 1734.4m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Some rain can be expected, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and strong and powerful sunlight. Changeable conditions.
